remarks: The direct product is smaller than any subgroup which contains the factors.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dprdlub.1 $e |- ( ph -> G dom DProd S ) $.
dprdlub.2 $e |- ( ph -> dom S = I ) $.
dprdlub.3 $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
dprdlub.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. I ) -> ( S ` k ) C_ T ) $.
dprdlub $p |- ( ph -> ( G DProd S ) C_ T ) $.
$d G k $.
$d I k $.
$d S k $.
$d T k $.
$d k ph $.
